definitions.definition: the process of being moved or carried from one place to another

examples.text: goods in transit between factory and store
Your insurance should cover transit by air, sea or rail.

definitions.definition: the act of going through a place on the way to somewhere else

examples.text: the transit lounge at Vienna airport
a **transit visa** *(= one that allows a person to pass through a country but not to stay there)*
The port has become a transit point in the drug trade.
The goods were still in a transit shed on the quay.
Transit passengers are not allowed to leave the airport.
If you are catching a connecting flight please wait in the transit lounge.

definitions.definition: the system of buses, trains, etc. that people use to travel from one place to another

examples.text: The New York transit strike is in its second day.
The city has acquired a light rail transit system.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (denoting passage from one place to another): from Latin transitus, from transire ‘go across’.
